- Personalised and age-appropriate

- Explanation of pathophysiological mechanisms (rectal vacuity)

- Hygienic and dietary measures

- Assessment of maternal nutrition in breastfed infants

- Checking bottle replenishment, water intake and diversification

- Medicinal treatment in older children to soften the stools and eliminate the vicious circle: hard stools-pain-retention to be prolonged for several months and then gradually reduced, always combined with hygienic and dietary measures:

o Osmotic (neonatal)

o PEG (from 6 months (high dose if faecal impaction))

o Washing if faecal impaction

Psychological treatment: may be useful if there is a psychological cause for the retention, if the disorder has psychosocial consequences, or if secondary benefits are sought.

question.title: What is the recommended approach to managing chronic constipation in children?
question.description: What is the most effective treatment for chronic constipation in children?

option_a.title: Only dietary changes and lifestyle modifications
option_a.description: A combination of dietary changes and lifestyle modifications, such as increasing fluid intake and ensuring adequate fiber consumption, may help manage chronic constipation in children.

option_b.title: Medicinal treatment with laxatives alone
option_b.description: Medicinal treatment with laxatives, such as osmotic laxatives or stimulant laxatives, may be necessary to soften stools and promote regular bowel movements in children with chronic constipation.

option_c.title: Psychological treatment for underlying psychological causes
option_c.description: Psychological treatment, such as counseling or behavioral therapy, may be helpful if there is a psychological cause for the constipation, or if the disorder has psychosocial consequences.

option_d.title: No treatment is necessary, as it is a normal part of childhood
option_d.description: Some parents may believe that constipation is a normal part of childhood and that it will resolve on its own, but this is not the case.

correct_option.title: A combination of dietary changes, lifestyle modifications, and medicinal treatment
correct_option.description: The most effective approach to managing chronic constipation in children is a combination of dietary changes, lifestyle modifications, and medicinal treatment, such as osmotic laxatives or stimulant laxatives, under the guidance of a healthcare provider.
